page.title: 06GUNWALLOE LIFE SAVING CLUB
page.content: Gunwalloe Surf Life Saving Club has existed for 26 years and in that time has saved 25 people from drowning.The club meets on Mondays for training, and is on duty every weekend and on the busiest evenings during the summer when holidaymakers pack the beach. You have to be 13 to belong. There are a number of awards to be gained. For 'Junior Survival' you must swim 500 metres in a variety of styles.For 'Sea Survival' you must swim 100m out to sea and back again; for 'Sea Survival 2', the same but over 200m.There is a 'Resuscitation Badge'. For the 'Qualifying Badge' you must perform a solo rescue, and must show that you can use hand, flag and whistle signals. There are also the more advanced Bronze,Silver and Gold awards.Other,rival clubs exist at Poldhu, Polurrian and Mullion Cove.
